courseDescription: Explores careers in the health professions.  Assists students in making informed choices regarding careers and programs of study and prepares students to apply for acceptance into health-related majors. Activities are included to help freshmen transition to college work.
Technical and Digital Skills: Using digital tools to explore career options
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Asking insightful questions about health professions
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing personal aptitudes for different health professions
Making informed decisions about career paths
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Planning academic paths towards career goals

courseTitle: Health Professions in the United States
courseDescription: This course examines the health care system in the U.S. and identifies the role played by selected health professions in the delivery of care.  Designed for students preparing themselves for entry into health related majors.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of U.S. health care system
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication within a health care context
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing roles within the health care system
Identifying solutions for health care delivery
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Understanding organizational structures in health care
Preparing for leadership roles in health professions

courseDescription: This course introduces students to information literacy and research in health disciplines in the context of future careers. Students will develop skills in searching, evaluating, and citing information required for health research projects.  The course examines the methods and tools of health analysis and explores the mechanics of research presentation and writing to help student pursuing health related majors and careers prepare for successful completion of upper-division requirements.  The class provides a brief introduction to ethical issues related to health research and writing.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of health research tools and methods
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Understanding and application of health research methods
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Understanding ethical issues in health research

courseTitle: Computer Technology Skills for the Health Professions
courseDescription: This course is designed to help students in the health professions gain the computer and technological skills needed to succeed in their academic careers and in today's workplace.  Students will develop personal competency in practical applications such as Google Docs, spreadsheets and presentation graphics, note taking applications, document revisions, computer hardware, information retrieval and ethics in health information.
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading Ethical Practices in Health Information

courseTitle: Leadership and Management for Health Professionals
courseDescription: A review of the administration, management, policies, and practices governed by scopes of practice in a variety of health care settings.  Topics covered include communication, planning and decision making, leadership and conflict management, and legal and ethical issues of concern to specific health professions.
Technical and Digital Skills: Knowledge in health policies and practices
Understanding of legal and ethical issues in healthcare
Familiarity with health care settings and scopes of practice
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication in health care settings
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Planning and decision making in health care
Analysis and interpretation of health policies
